Job Title: Unreal Artist - Automotive Visualization - (Hybrid out of our Detroit, Chicago, NYC, Los Angeles or Long Beach offices)

Location: Troy, MI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
At Designory’s 3D & Interactive division, we’re building product visualizations, digital walkthroughs,

VR/AR experiences, images and video, and game assets for big brands for automotive.

We’re looking for strong Lighting artists who can integrate into a global team to create stunning automobiles in Unreal Engine.

We value strong technical skills, a creative eye, and a wild passion for building immersive content.

Location: Hybrid out of our Los Angeles, Long Beach, Chicago, NYC or Detroit offices.

Schedule: Hybrid - In office three days per week and 2 remote

Salary Range: $75,000 to $90,000 a year

Responsibilities:

 Collaborate with our creative directors, our game developers, and our engineers to create stunning images, videoes, and immersive brand experiences in Unreal 5.3. Work with Maya data as a base and be able to optimize for Unreal Engine. Assist with creating rich outdoor 3D environments. Help us innovate with your creativity and ideas.

Requirements:

 5 Years of experience lighting in Unreal. Portfolio showcasing automotive in real-time environments in Unreal. Great communication skills and experience working through remote collaboration platforms. Highly proficient with 3D modeling and data optimization.  Skilled at texturing, rigging, and some proficiency at animation. Beginner to intermediate knowledge of game scripting (C++/Blueprints). Experience with source control (SVN, Git, Perforce, or Plastic). Strong proficiency in Unreal 5. Proficiency in Maya or 3ds a plus. Ability to originate 3D models such as props (trees, foliage, roads, and other environment details) are a bonus. Ability to create or kitbash 3D environments a plus. VR/AR/XR experience is a plus. Associate degree in computer science, game development, or fine arts preferred. Must have experience working with profiling tools. Must be able to work in a fast-paced agency environment.

We’re very interested in groups of people who have worked well together before. Group referrals are welcome.

Designory is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Designory does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
